item.title: Manage your SQL Server database lifecycle with .NET Aspire and the SQL Database Projects hosting extension
item.description: .NET Aspire provides tools, templates, and packages to help you build observable, production-ready apps. Delivered through NuGet packages, .NET Aspire simplifies common challenges in modern app development. Today's apps often rely on multiple services like databases, messaging, and caching, many supported by .NET Aspire Integrations, including community extensions in the .NET Aspire Community Toolkit.

item.title: Spaced Repetition Systems Have Gotten Way Better
item.description: Spaced repetition systems are a well-known way to efficiently learn material. Recent innovations have applied machine learning to greatly improve their scheduling.

item.title: Try AniSora: The Ultimate Anime Video Generation Model
item.description: Index-AniSora is the most powerful open-source animated video generation model presented by Bilibili. It enables one-click creation of video shots across diverse anime styles including series episodes, Chinese original animations, manga adaptations, VTuber content, anime PVs, mad-style parodies, and more

item.title: Reverse Engineering the Renpho App
item.description: I use Home Assistant to automate my home. This mostly involves turning lights and music on and off but I really like the idea of the dashboard being a sort of hub for my abode.

item.title: Vibe coding is metaprogramming - foobuzz
item.description: I originally wanted to write 2 distinct articles, but realized that they shared the same underlying idea: "Vibe coding", the act of talking to an LLM / LLM-based AI agent to code a full project without writing a line of code manually, is no more than a metaprogramming technique, where a program (the AI agent), produces another program (the code that gets committed). As such, it shares some common characteristics of metaprogramming, notably: 1) The use-case of using metaprogramming when lacking an abstraction. 2) The poor experience of maintaining metaprogramming output when you can't maintain the generator level.

item.title: The Ingredients of a Productive Monorepo
item.description: So! Suppose you‚Äôre an intrepid engineer in a nascent Developer Productivity team. Your engineering organization has decided that it wants to move towards a monorepo. You‚Äôve heard the stories told of Google, Meta, Uber - each a large technology company with developer productivity organizations consisting of hundreds of engineers - and you want to capture some of their magic in a bottle and give it to your users. You wonder - what work lies ahead of you?

item.title: ARK003: Developing Mobile Application (Part 2)
item.description:
üöÄ Project ARK ‚Äì Session 4: Building the Mobile Experience Welcome back to Project ARK! In this session, we continue developing the mobile application by building the components that bring Acts of Random Kindness to life.
üëâ What you'll learn in this video: 0/ How to structure and build view services for clean data flow 1/ Creating base components for a consistent UI 2/ Building reusable components and pages to display ARKs 3/ Tips for organizing your mobile project for scalability and maintainability By the end of this session, you‚Äôll see real ARK entries rendered in the app ‚Äî a major milestone in our journey!
üí° Whether you're following along or just exploring mobile architecture, this session is packed with practical patterns and thoughtful design.
üìå Don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit the bell to stay updated with future sessions!
Link to ARK backend API: https://github.com/hassanhabib/ARK.Core.Api
Link to ARK Mobile app: https://github.com/hassanhabib/ARK.Apps.Mobile
#ProjectARK #MobileDevelopment #ActsOfRandomKindness #AppDevelopment #ComponentBasedDesign
item.author: (Hassan Habib)
